intro: Fimbristylis minima, commonly known as the dwarf sedge, is a small, herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It typically grows in wet or moist soils, often in marshy or swampy areas. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pale green or brown. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. Fimbristylis minima is often found in disturbed habitats and can be an indicator of wetland environments.
